definition[0]: to make someone or something stop moving forward
example[0]: Police in riot gear held back the demonstrators.
definition[1]: to stop yourself from feeling or showing a particular emotion
example[1]: She struggled to hold back her tears.
example[2]: Anger flooded through her. She couldn’t hold it back.
definition[2]: to prevent someone or something from making progress
example[3]: They felt the British economy was being held back by excessive government controls.
definition[3]: to be unwilling to do something, especially because you are being careful, or to make someone unwilling to do something
example[4]: In the current situation many investors are holding back.
example[5]: She wanted to tell him but pride held her back.
example[6]: Tell me all about it – don’t hold anything back!
